intro: Selinum villarsii, commonly known as the mountain garlic or alpine garlic, is a perennial herb native to the alpine regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots, parsley, and dill, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Selinum villarsii thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or mountainous habitats. Its aromatic foliage and medicinal properties have made it of interest in traditional herbal medicine.
